title: Finding a
text: First, we must factor by grouping to find a.

title: Factor by Grouping
text: What is the GCF between $$3x^2$$ and $$6x$$?

title: Factor by Grouping
text: Since the GCF is 3, we factor both terms by 3 and now have (3*((x**2)+(2*x))-1.

title: Completing the Square
text: We must complete the square to rewrite the equation in the $$a {\left(x+b\right)}^2+k$$ form.

title: Completing the Square
text: First, we divide the second term of the polynomial by 2, which in this case is 1, since $$\frac{2}{2}$$ is 1.

title: Completing the Square
text: Next, we square term we got from dividing and add it inside of the polynomial, which in this case is 1, since $$1^2$$ is 1.

title: Completing the Square
text: After this, we notice that we can't just add in a 1, so we subtract 3 from our total equation outside of the parentheses, since a is 3 and $$3\times1$$ is 3.

title: Completing the Square
text: Finally, we simplify our polynomial to $$3{\left(x+1\right)}^2-4$$.
